title: This electric car can go 520 miles on a charge
description: The Lucid Air Dream Edition was recently rated by the Environmental Protection Agency with an estimated driving range of 520 miles on a full charge. That's the longest range of any purely battery-powered car yet rated by the EPA, including Tesla's Model S Long Range.

title: 'The Daily Show' takes on anti-mask parents
description: "The Daily Show" contributor Jordan Klepper hit the road to talk to parents in North Carolina about why they are against masks in classrooms.

title: What we know about the deadly blast in Kabul on the weekend
description: An explosion ripped through a crowd in central Kabul killing seven people, an Afghan Ministry of the Interior source told CNN's Clarissa Ward. The blast targeted the gates of the Eidgah Mosque in the Afghan capital, where a funeral service was being held for the mother of Taliban spokesman Zabihullah Muhajid.

title: Chicago sees deadliest summer in 2021 with gun violence on the rise
description: CNN's Omar Jimenez reports on rising gun violence in Chicago after 1,606 people were shot in a single three-month summer period in the city.

title: Dr. Fauci refutes Republican misconceptions on spread of Covid-19
description: Dr. Anthony Fauci says that immigrants and tourists are not main driver behind new Covid-19 cases in the US after a new poll found that Republicans voters believed these two factors were major reasons for the virus' spread.

title: Portugal now has the world's highest vaccination rate. Hear how it happened
description: Earlier in the year Portugal had one of the worst Covid-19 outbreaks on the planet. Now, the small Atlantic nation has become the country with the largest percentage of people fully vaccinated against Covid-19 (85%). And though the number of daily cases is still high, deaths and hospitalizations from Covid-19 have remained low throughout the summer, with the results plain to see: businesses are open and tourism is making a comeback. CNN's Vasco Cotovio reports.

title: Actor records excuse video for teen who missed history class
description: When 16-year-old Luke Stevens missed a history test to hang out with Lin Manuel Miranda, he enlisted the Hamilton star's help in recording a video message for his teacher.

title: 'SNL' returns with a new Joe Biden, looking to unite Democrats
description: "Saturday Night Live" is back, and with it came a new President Joe Biden.

title: A major oil spill off the California coast has caused dead birds, fish and oil to wash up on Huntington Beach, officials say
description: A spill of about 3,000 barrels of oil -- or roughly 126,000 gallons of post-production crude -- off the coast of Southern California is a "potential ecological disaster," Huntington Beach Mayor Kim Carr said Saturday.

title: Man dies after falling while subway surfing
description: A man in New York City died early Saturday morning while subway surfing on top of the J-train on the Williamsburg Bridge.

title: New Zealand says foreign nationals must have coronavirus vaccination to enter country
description: All foreign nationals entering New Zealand will need to be fully vaccinated from November 1, the government announced Sunday.

title: How America ruined Christmas
description: The supply chain nightmare that's been plaguing the global economy for over a year is about to snarl the holiday shopping season. Think barren shelves, massive shipping delays, and no small amount of sticker shock. Merry Christmas, everyone!

title: Winning numbers announced for Saturday's $635 million Powerball jackpot
description: The winning numbers for a Powerball jackpot estimated at $635 million were drawn on Saturday.

title: Taiwan says China sends 77 warplanes into its defense zone in two days
description: Taiwan has reported a record number of incursions by Chinese warplanes into its air defense identification zone (ADIZ) for the second day in a row, Taiwan's Ministry of National Defense said on Saturday night.

title: 'Every one of those deaths is unnecessary,' expert says of rising Covid-19 US death toll
description: With a first-of-its-kind antiviral pill against Covid-19 potentially headed towards distribution, the health care community may soon have another tool to combat a virus that has claimed the lives of more than 700,000 Americans.

title: How a simple hand gesture has kicked off an online firestorm in South Korea
description: • South Korea's young men are fighting against feminism

title: More than 230 people arrested in Nebraska anti-gang operation dubbed 'K.O.'
description: A multi-agency law enforcement operation in Nebraska resulted in the arrest of 231 people, according to the US Marshals Service.

title: A look at the women who brought R. Kelly to justice
description: Behind the downfall of R. Kelly stand dozens of women who helped bring attention to his crimes and those who helped prosecute him.

title: The tradition traces back to the 1700s. These women are fighting to keep it alive through online retail.
description: Many African cultures in the United States have been fighting to keep their traditions and unique way of life alive, and now, an online retail outlet is helping the Gullah community in Charleston, South Carolina, use tech to reach a wider audience.

title: South Africa's skateboarders are kick-flipping to the next level
description: From the streets of South African cities to the world stage of the Olympic Games, skateboarding continues to grow across the African continent. Meet the Olympians, local skate legends, and equipment design gurus elevating their sport to new heights.

title: Police failures exposed by Sarah Everard murder underpin dark culture
description: When thousands gathered to mourn the death of Sarah Everard, a 33-year-old woman who was kidnapped, raped and murdered in March, London police responded with force.

title: Woman shot by school safety officer to be disconnected from life support, family says
description: An 18-year-old woman shot by a school safety officer after an altercation near a Long Beach, California, high school is expected to be disconnected from life support this weekend, her family said at a news conference Friday.

title: Thousands protest across Brazil calling for President Bolsonaro's impeachment
description: Protesters returned to the streets in major cities across Brazil on Saturday, calling for the impeachment of President Jair Bolsonaro amid worsening economic conditions, rising unemployment, and hunger in the Covid-wracked country.

title: Should you get a Covid-19 booster now? An expert weighs in
description: To get a booster or not? The US Food and Drug Administration and US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention have issued guidance that some adults can receive a third shot of the Pfizer/BioNTech Covid-19 vaccine, so it's time to ask that question.

title: Oregon man charged in fatal shooting of man who spoke to his girlfriend
description: An Oregon man has been arrested and indicted on charges stemming from the fatal shooting of a man that prosecutors say occurred after the victim spoke to the suspect's girlfriend.
